title: 28 states have legislation to promote ivermectin access
author: Mackenzie Bean
description: More than half of all U.S. states have proposed or passed legislation designed to promote access to ivermectin, according to data from the Federation of State Medical Boards.
cleaned_text: More than half of all U.S. states have proposed or passed legislation designed to promote access to ivermectin, according to [data](https://track.govhawk.com/reports/2lWe3/public) from the Federation of State Medical Boards. Twenty-eight states have bills that would either restrict medical boards' authority to discipline clinicians who prescribe the unproven COVID-19 treatment, allow off-label use of the medication or both. Many of these states are concentrated in the Midwest and Southeast. The legislation reflects [growing political pressure](https://www.beckershospitalreview.com/hospital-physician-relationships/political-pressure-affecting-medical-boards-misinformation-policies.html) to restrict boards' authority to penalize physicians over health misinformation. In July 2021, the Federation of State Medical Boards [warned](https://www.beckershospitalreview.com/digital-marketing/physicians-who-post-covid-19-vaccine-misinformation-may-lose-license-medical-panel-says.html) that physicians spreading COVID-19 misinformation online and in the media may be at risk of losing their medical licenses.
